message.content:
cs.AI, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.SE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as it presents a declarative programming paradigm for finding feasible and optimal solutions to constraint systems. It also proposes various operators for expressing global constraints and deduction capabilities, which are commonly used in AI applications. 

It is also likely to belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category as it introduces a lightweight implementation of stratified reasoning for logical connectives, which is a fundamental concept in programming languages. 

The Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category is also a likely fit as the paper deals with logical connectors and reasoning. 

The Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category is a possible fit as the paper discusses the use of constructive reasoning for domain pruning during constraint filtering, which is a common problem in algorithm design. 

Finally, the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category is a possible fit as the paper proposes an open-source library built on top of SICStus Prolog clp(fd), which is a software engineering tool commonly used for constraint programming.
